properties.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued January 10 at 3:34PM EST until January 12 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Significant icing expected. Total snow accumulations of
1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of four tenths to one half
of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph.

* WHERE...Midland and Bay Counties.

* WHEN...From 4 AM Saturday to 7 AM EST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the
ice and strong winds. Travel could be nearly impossible. Gusty
winds could bring down tree branches.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures are expected to fall below
freezing late Friday night. There remains a chance that even
colder air may work into the area resulting in higher snow and
sleet accumulations which will cut into ice accumulations.
Prepare for the possibility of extended power outages and avoid
travel if possible.
properties.instruction:
Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra
flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an
emergency. Prepare for possible power outages.

NWSheadline: ICE STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SATURDAY TO 7 AM EST SUNDAY
